headline.main: Conservative Group to Air Ads Attacking Health Law in Michigan and Iowa

docs.abstract: One of the country’s most well-funded conservative groups is betting that public anger against President Obama’s signature health initiative is broad and deep enough to expand the field of competitive Senate races at stake this November.
docs.snippet: One of the country’s most well-funded conservative groups is betting that public anger against President Obama’s signature health initiative is broad and deep enough to expand the field of competitive Senate races at stake this November.

docs.lead_paragraph: Negotiators in the U.S. Congress on Monday unveiled a $1.1 trillion spending bill that aims to prevent another government shutdown while boosting funding levels slightly for military and domestic programs - but not for "Obamacare" health reforms.
docs.snippet: Negotiators in the U.S. Congress on Monday unveiled a $1.1 trillion spending bill that aims to prevent another government shutdown while boosting funding levels slightly for military and domestic programs - but not for "Obamacare" health reforms.

docs.lead_paragraph: A chastened Congress is putting aside the crisis-driven budget battles of the past three years, embracing a $1.1 trillion spending bill that restores or smooths the sharpest edges of the automatic cuts imposed as a result of its own dysfunction.

headline.main: Huge Budget Bill Aims to Show Congress' Mettle
headline.print_headline: Huge Budget Bill Aims to Show Congress' Mettle

docs.lead_paragraph: New York is signing up enough young subscribers to make the insurance system viable, state senators were told at a hearing, but some enrollees have found problems in the program.

headline.main: Mixed Reports on State Health Exchange
headline.print_headline: Mixed Reports on State Health Exchange

docs.abstract: New York State Senate hearing shows that state is enrolling a significant number of young subscribers on its health insurance exchange, but many of those already enrolled have raised questions about rules that limit which doctors they can see, or are having problems finding out if their doctors are covered.
docs.snippet: New York is signing up enough young subscribers to make the insurance system viable, state senators were told at a hearing, but some enrollees have found problems in the program.

docs.lead_paragraph: The trillion-dollar spending plan finances the government through September, reverses some cuts to military veterans’ pensions and defeats efforts to curb President Obama’s health care law.

headline.main: House and Senate Negotiators Agree on Spending Bill
headline.print_headline: House and Senate Negotiators Agree on Spending Bill

docs.abstract: House and Senate negotiators reach accord on trillion-dollar spending plan that will finance government through September 2014; plan reverses some cuts to military veterans’ pensions that were included in broader budget agreement and defeats efforts to rein in Pres Obama's health care law.
docs.snippet: The trillion-dollar spending plan finances the government through September, reverses some cuts to military veterans’ pensions and defeats efforts to curb President Obama’s health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans seized on the latest insurance enrollment numbers under the Affordable Care Act as evidence that the law would not work.

headline.main: Older Pool of Health Care Enrollees Stirs Fears on Costs
headline.print_headline: Older People Lead Sign-Ups for Insurance

docs.abstract: Obama administration officials say people signing up for health insurance through Affordable Care Act's marketplaces tend to be older and potentially less healthy; demographic mix could threaten law's underpinnings and cause premiums to rise in future; Republicans seize on enrollment numbers as evidence that law will not work.
docs.snippet: Republicans seized on the latest insurance enrollment numbers under the Affordable Care Act as evidence that the law would not work.
